intro: Dissotis kaessneriana, commonly known as the pink sedge, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant is characterized by its triangular, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered pink or white flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Dissotis kaessneriana is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and flowering display.
